thread.title: NBA trades: Nerlens Noel dealt to Mavs as Sixers get two players, draft pick, report says
thread.title_full: NBA trades: Nerlens Noel dealt to Mavs as Sixers get two players, draft pick, report says

author: Bob Hille (Bob.Hille@performgroup.com)
title: NBA trades: Nerlens Noel dealt to Mavs as Sixers get two players, draft pick, report says
text:
February 23, 2017 12:11pm EST February 23, 2017 12:11pm EST Basketball, NBA, News, Dallas Mavericks, Philadelphia 76ers, English The Sixers get SG Justin Anderson, C Andrew Bogut and a first-round pick for the 6-11 Noel, 22. Nerlens Noel (Getty Images) 
Updated at 12:11 p.m. ET 
Updated at 12:11 p.m. ET 
The 76ers are sending big man Nerlens Noel to the Mavericks for Justin Anderson, Andrew Bogut and a conditional first-round draft pick ahead of the trade deadline, The Vertical reported Thursday, citing unidentified NBA sources. 
Much of the deadline-day buzz around the Sixers has focused on Jahlil Okafor, but Thursday's trade moves another of Philly's young big men. 
MORE: NBA trade rumors: Jimmy Butler, Carmelo Anthony lead biggest names to watch on deadline day 
According to The Vertical, the Mavs long have been intrigued with the 6-11 Noel and will work to sign the 22-year-old to an extension. 
He will be a restricted free agent after this season, his third in the NBA, in which he is averaging 9.0 points and 5.0 rebounds in 19.4 minutes per game. 
In Anderson, the 76ers get a 6-6 shooting guard who is averaging 6.5 points, 2.9 rebounds and 0.6 assists in 13.9 minutes per game in his second NBA season 
Bogut, 32, is in his 11th season in the league but first in Dallas, and the 7-footer who won a championship with the Warriors two seasons ago is averaging 3.0 points and 8.3 rebounds in 22.4 minutes. 
According to multiple reports, Bogut isn't expected to stay with the Sixers. ESPN says he is expected to negotiate a buyout, and the Cavaliers have been monitoring him this season. Meanwhile, NBA.com reported reported that Bogut could be "re-routed" after the deal, with the Celtics mentioned as a possible destination. Watch This
